recipe.name: Sausage and Egg Stuffed Potatoes
recipe.description: Breakfast favorites, assembled in a potato skin! This idea lends itself to many other possibilities such as adding bacon, mushroom, spinach, or finely chopped other greens with the sausage.
recipeIngredient: 7 - 8 oz / 200 - 250g   sausages ((the best you can afford) meat removed from casings (Note 3))
1/4 cup grated cheese ((any melting cheese of choice, I used cheddar))

recipeInstructions.text: Cut the lid off the potatoes and scoop out the flesh. If the potatoes are cold, pop them in the oven to warm up while it is preheating. (Note 4)
recipeInstructions.name: Cut the lid off the potatoes and scoop out the flesh. If the potatoes are cold, pop them in the oven to warm up while it is preheating. (Note 4)

recipeInstructions.text: Heat 1/2 tbsp of olive oil in a fry pan over high heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned, using a wooden spoon to break the sausage up into little pieces (as small as you can).
recipeInstructions.name: Heat 1/2 tbsp of olive oil in a fry pan over high heat. Add the sausage and cook until browned, using a wooden spoon to break the sausage up into little pieces (as small as you can).

recipeInstructions.text: Optional step: Brush the outside of the potatoes with melted butter or olive oil - for extra flavour and crispiness.
recipeInstructions.name: Optional step: Brush the outside of the potatoes with melted butter or olive oil - for extra flavour and crispiness.

recipeInstructions.text: Fill the potatoes with sausage, pressing down to compress as much as you can (this prevents egg sinking into the sausage).
recipeInstructions.name: Fill the potatoes with sausage, pressing down to compress as much as you can (this prevents egg sinking into the sausage).

recipeInstructions.text: Crack the egg on top, sprinkle with cheese, then place in the oven to bake for 18 to 25 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still runny. Check it at 15 minutes then take a peek every 5 minutes - I find that it can go from uncooked to overcooked quickly. My oven was heated well and my potato was piping hot so it took 18 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Crack the egg on top, sprinkle with cheese, then place in the oven to bake for 18 to 25 minutes, or until the egg whites are set and the yolks are still runny. Check it at 15 minutes then take a peek every 5 minutes - I find that it can go from uncooked to overcooked quickly. My oven was heated well and my potato was piping hot so it took 18 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Remove from the oven and serve immediately, sprinkled with parsley if using.
recipeInstructions.name: Remove from the oven and serve immediately, sprinkled with parsley if using.

review.reviewBody:
This was an easy, tasty option for breakfast, I will do these again, I may even try in a sweet potato.

Loved it.

We have had a house full of people to feed the last few days (while the sun was shining) Helping us build a Green House. So there have been quite a few more mouths to feed. I made this recipe yesterday at breakfast for 8 it was so fast and easy even the clean up was simple, as I did every thing except the egg the night before. Warming the potato/sausage for those who like runny yolks and just popping the egg in at the start for those who didn't, they were all ready at the same time!!!

I love your notes section, which you seem to include with each recipe.  I've never seen such thoroughness on a blog site, cookbook, or anywhere else.  Those are the kinds of things you just have to learn by trial and error, which makes for a lot of sad meals.  Thank you!  I'm new to your site, but I'll look here first before cooking from now on.  Your recipes look delicious and your notes seal the deal.
Yummy. I made something similar but before adding the sausage and eggs, I deep fried the potato skins.  Yours are much healthier.  :)

This is a great idea! I absolutely love potatoes, sausage, and eggs (basically any breakfast food) and am always looking for brunch recipes to serve a crowd. Brilliant :)

This also sounds really delicious for dinner too, btw!

recipe.keywords: Jacket Potatoes, Sausage and Egg Stuffed Potatoes
